H0.text: The tilt of Earth explains why a particular place on Earth receives more energy during summer months than winter months, as observed by Jamil in his study of how Earth's position around the Sun affects the energy available on Earth.

H1.text: The rotation of Earth explains why a particular place receives more energy during summer months than winter months, as studied by Jamil who investigated how Earth's position around the Sun affects the energy available on Earth.

H2.text: The distance between Earth and the Sun explains why a particular place on Earth receives more energy during summer months than winter months, as observed by Jamil in his study of how Earth's position around the Sun affects the energy available on Earth.

H3.text: The amount of rays produced by the Sun explains why a particular place on Earth receives more energy during summer months than winter months, as Jamil studied how Earth's position around the Sun affects the energy available on Earth.

A4.text: Earth's axis remains tilted in the same direction with reference to the background stars throughout a year (regardless of where it is in its orbit) â€“ this is known as axial parallelism. This means that one pole (and the associated hemisphere of Earth) will be directed away from the Sun at one side of the orbit, and half an orbit later (half a year later) this pole will be directed towards the Sun. This is the cause of Earth's seasons.
